intro: Dimorphanthera alpivaga, commonly known as the alpine dimorphanthera, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its erect stems and showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
